text:
500ml bottle purchased from Lifesource in Salem OR
$3.99
Pours a lovely sunlight yellow with a rather handsome creamy white head.
Aroma of hay, cream, vanilla and a faint grassy hop. Good.
Taste similar to aroma but with a nice mellow fruitiness..maybe hops a bit too strong but OK.
Palate is very nice medium body and high medium crbonation cleanse the palate fast.
Over all a good beer..but for me it is a tad too hoppy for a traditional helles.
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of malt, citrus. Tastes of malt, citrus fruit and peel. Light body with a dry finish. Solid helles.

On tap at elliot Bay, pours a clear pale golden straw with a large white head. Aroma of petting zoo feed grain, Grassy hops, and yeast. Taste of earthy dry grain, sourdough, and dry bitter crisp hops. Awesome!

Surprised me with how much I liked this, not usually a fan of more lager beers,light and sweet body with a nice base of cereal, tropical and honey notes, maybe a bit of rice. Complicated and not like drinking a $5 macro.
On tap at the brewery in Hood River light pale malts standard pale lager. Soft smooth bodied.

On tap at CBC 2017, pours a clear yellow with some fluffy, white head. Nose is solid, grass, grist, yeast, some lemon balm. Flavor is biscuits, some grist, flower petals, grass, straw, light lemon. Crisp, dry finish. Very drinkable.
On tap at the brewery Pours out a golden topped with a white head. Nose is a nice grain some earthy grass hops. taste is more of the nice malt grain and grassy notes.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Golden with a white hat. Bready, toasted, spice, faint grassy hops. Medium bodied. Finishes clean with a mild lingering bite. A sixer of this and a campfire, please.

On tap at the brewery. One hell of a helles. Pours a totally clear yellow color with a large white head. A bready lemon citrus nose. The flavor is toasted malts, light citrus, crisp floral nose. Very smooth. I could drink a few liters. Awesome.

Draft at Pfriem.

A: Clear gold with a firm pure white head. Lots of bubbles.

N: Grist, white wine grapes, some pine and earth, cracker, peppercorn, some coriander, toast, honey.

T: Clean bitterness and sweetness.

M: Light creamy body, foamy carbonation, no alcohol 

O: A clean, quaffable Helles. This is really good; one of the best Helles Ive ever had.

On draught at pFriem. Colour...very pale gold with a thin white head. Nose...lightly malty with notes of crackers and biscuits. Palate...pretty frothy and somewhat crackery with faint malt and a bit of huskiness. The finish is quick.
Buttery malt nose. Fat and puffy texture. Mainly malt, a little steel, and a tiny hint of herb in the mouth. Pretty tasty and clean.

Draught at St. Augustines, Vancouver, 14 ozHazy dark blond color with small compact head. The aroma is lightly grassy, the malt flavor is mellow, with a hay accent, a bit sweeter than the Helles Im used to, with just a little hop grassy touch.Quite simple, I expected more from pFriem.
Golden. Malty, fresh biscuity malts, light toastiness, and a full assertive finish.

On tap at pFriem, pours a clear copper with a small white head. Aroma of very light herbal notes and a little grass. Flavour is very subtle, with lightly toasted malt and light herbal notes. Very sessionable and easy drinking, but very bland and uninspiring. Decent.

Tap at pFriem, Hood River, 24/05/13.
Clear pale golden with a thin white head.
Nose is cereals, corn, grass, light caramel.
Taste comprises citrus, caramel, pale malts, light bread dough, grass.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp finish with a hint of bitterness.
Clean drinking Helles - decent enough representation of the style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND
